overview: Richard Cooke was appointed CEO of Esat Group after it’s acquisition by British Telecom in January 2000 for $2.5bn. Esat ,now known as BT Ireland, is the second largest telecoms provider in Ireland with annual revenues in excess of â‚¬300m and circa 1,000 employees. During his time with BT, he also served as Vice President of BT Global Services between 2000 to 2002 . Prior to his appointment as CEO of Esat, he was Managing Director of its subsidiary , EsatNet between 1997 and 2000 and grew that business to become the largest commercial Internet Service Provider in Ireland. He has over 20 years of experience in senior roles within the ICT sector with British Telecom, Esat Telecom Group, LAKE Communications and Alcatel Business Systems.
